content.text:
# List of discount shops in the United Kingdom

This is a list of the current and defunct discount chains of the United Kingdom. This list does not include discount supermarket chains which can be found at list of supermarket chains in the United Kingdom.
List of current discount shops

!class=unsortable|Image

!Notes

|B&M
|
|style="text-align:center;" |1978
|B&M European Value Retail S.A.
|741
|The business was founded by Malcolm Billington as Billington & Mayman and the first store opened in Cleveleys, England, in 1978 and was acquired by Simon and Bobby Arora from Phildrew Investments in December 2004
|-
|Bargain Buys
|
|style="text-align:center;" |2013
|Fortress Investment Group
|61
|Brand launched by Poundworld founder Chris Edwards to replace former DiscountUK brand, which closed with failure of parent company. Restarted as a sister brand by Poundstretcher.
|-

|
|2

|

|
|style="text-align:center;" |1997
|Tilley Family
|21
|Father and son Ray and Peter Tilley started Tilley's Tools in Cornwall, before running it as a wholesale business from Weston Super Mare. Proper Job was started in 1997 is based in Somerset.
|-
|QD
|
|
|QD Commercial Group Holdings
|31
|Discount group based mainly in East of England & the Home Counties

|Discount branded health, home and beauty.

|
|Chain of discount shops located in Devon, Dorset and Somerset

|
|
|South of England-based discount department store went into administration late 80s
|-
|Hypervalue
|
|style="text-align:center;" |1980
|style="text-align:center;" |2009
|Hilco
|
|Discount chain mainly located in South Wales, but had shops as afar as Southampton, bought by Hilco in 2006 before going into administration
|-
|...instore
|
|style="text-align:center;" |2002
|style="text-align:center;" |2007
|instore plc
|
|...instore was a new corporate name that failed for £-stretcher business – name reverted to Poundstretcher
|-
|Max 99p
|
|style="text-align:center;" |2013
|style="text-align:center;" |2018
|
|4
|Family owned chain of discount shops located in Peterborough, Chelmsford, Pontypridd and Woolston. Went into liquidation in 2018.
|-
|JC Nicholls
|
|
|
|
|
|Trading name operated by the Yorkshire Trading Company that was phased out.
|-
|One Up
|
|style="text-align:center;" |1993
|
|
|16
|Clothing and Home discounter created by Storehouse plc, sold off in 1995 for £20m
|-
|Parker Franks
|
|
|
|Owned by Philip Green
|
|Northwest-based discounter of homewares and clothing; changed its name to Xception
|-
|Poundworld
|
|style="text-align:center;" |1974
|style="text-align:center;" |2018
|TPG
|>300
|Business started as market stall in Wakefield; branded Poundworld from 2004. Also traded as Poundworld Extra and Poundworld Plus
|-
|Quality Save
|
|style="text-align:center;" |1974
|style="text-align:center;" |2024
|Richard Rudkin & Paul Rudkin
|21
|Business started as a market stall in Walkden, north-based discount chain. Taken over by Home Bargains and rebranded.
|-
|QS Stores
|
|style="text-align:center;" |1932
|style="text-align:center;" |2006
|Hamsard 2353
|143
|QS started life as a clothing manufacturer. In 1960s they opened their first shop selling clothing rejected by main buyer Marks & Spencer. In 1980s the shop stopped selling seconds and went private in 1990. Was purchased by Hamsard 2353 in 2003 who brought it together with fellow purchase Bewise. Business went into administration in 2006. Some shops became part of Store Twenty One.
|-
|Shop Direct Group
|
|
|
|
|10
|Discounter of surplus stock from within the Shop Direct family of companies
|-
|Store Twenty One
|
|style="text-align:center;" |2007
|style="text-align:center;" |2017
|Grabal Alok
|200
|Discount clothing and homewares, created from the ashes of QS Stores and Bewise
|-
|Thing - Me - Bobs
|
|
|style="text-align:center;" |2022
|QD Commercial Group Holdings
|11
|Stores purchased by QD in 2013. Moved to QD branding in 2022.
|-
|Waremart
|
|
|style="text-align:center;" |2009
|
|
|Chain of discounters based in Yorkshire and northeast in former Woolworths shops
|-
|What Everyone Wants
|
|style="text-align:center;" |1990
|style="text-align:center;" |2003
|Tradegro
|130
|Formerly What Every Woman Wants, a Scottish chain of discount shops that became UK national in 1990 after its purchase by Brown & Jackson, owners of £-Stretcher. Sold to Tradegro in November 2002 before going into administration a month later. Locations were bought by Poundstretcher and Bewise
|-
|Woolworths
|
|style="text-align:center;" |1909
|style="text-align:center;" |2009
|Woolworths Group plc
|807
|Company went into administration, name lives on as a web-based retailer owned by Shop Direct Group
|-
|Xception
|
|
|
|Philip Green
|
|New name for northwest-based Parker Franks, a discounter selling a variety of clothes and homewares
|-
|Your Home Stores
|
|
|
|
|
|Greater Manchester based discounter of homewares
|-
|Your More Store
|
|style="text-align:center;" |1991
|style="text-align:center;" |2004
|Tradegro
|199
|Set up Pepkor in 1991, the stores were based in Scotland and the North East of England. Bought by Brown & Jackson, owners of £-stretcher in 1997, before being sold to Tradegro in 2003 while in administration.
|-
